DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : A walk program may improve ability carry daily activity donor bone marrow transplant . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study structured walking program see well work compare standard therapy cancer patient undergo donor bone marrow transplant .
DOC.brief_title: A Structured Walking Program Standard Therapy Cancer Patients Undergoing Donor Bone Marrow Transplant
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Compare effect structure walk regimen v normal standard care functional status day 100 allogeneic bone marrow transplantation patient cancer . Secondary - Compare effect regimens patient survival day 100 1 year transplantation . - Compare patient satisfaction regimen . OUTLINE : This randomize study . Patients randomize 1 2 intervention arm . - Arm I : Beginning 2-3 day allogeneic bone marrow transplantation , patient walk treadmill hospital hallway twice daily ≥ 15 minute . After discharge continue 100 day post-transplantation , patient walk daily ≥ 30 minute . Patients record walk time daily journal . - Arm II : Patients receive special instruction regard exercise normal standard care . All patient complete questionnaire discharge day 100 post-transplantation measure daily exercise activity , satisfaction recommend walk regimen , functional status . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 90 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosis 1 follow malignancy : Acute lymphocytic leukemia Chronic myelogenous leukemia Acute myeloid leukemia Hodgkin 's lymphoma NonHodgkin 's lymphoma Myelodysplastic syndromes Other malignancy Undergoing concurrent allogeneic bone marrow transplantation PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Able walk PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics
